availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Clements Vonderhaar (Cincinnati, Ohio, laborer and soldier)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, laborer and soldier. Native of Germany. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from June 4, 1861. Transferred to the 8th Regiment Veteran Reserve Corps (U.S.A.) on August 20, 1863. Returned to the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) on May 17, 1864, and served until June 18, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0160.
Special Schedules of the Eleventh Census (1890) Enumerating Union Veterans and Widows of Union Veterans of the Civil War, Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Publication M123, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, p. 17.
Find A Grave, "Clements Vonderhahr (1822-1893)," Memorial #130698779, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130698779 (accessed January 2, 2021).
